title: Type ID "El corte Ingles"
content:
Hi gurus, i’m newie in this forums :). Some kind soul can tell me what is this font?. TIA

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logoCorting.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=logoCorting.jpg) | 31.43 KB |
author: juque

comments.content:
I believe that is hand-drawn, not a font.

- Mike Yanega

However, if you are looking for something that might be similar, I could suggest Canada Type’s [‘Apricot’](http://web.archive.org/web/20060110041524/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/apricot/), which is a vertical monoline script with many alternate characters and ligatures. (See the sample from the Script Font ID Guide at [http://bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg12.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20060110041524/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script07Pg12.html)). If you thickened the strokes, I think you could make a rough approximation of your sample using a font.

- Mike Yanega
Yes Mike, but [Harold Lohner](http://web.archive.org/web/20060110041524/http:/members.aol.com/fontner/frontpage.html) made something about it, look for Espanglés.

Thanks Ignacio, that’s a new one for the collection.

- Mike Yanega
Mike, Ignacio: Thank you so much.
Wow. Harold has some good stuff. Too bad you can’t see it so well in his jungle of a website.
